text: 9月28号下单后，系统显示已经发货，一直等等等，结果等到10月12号依然没有收到货。查询亚马逊订单状态，卖家也没有提供快递单号，查不到订单在哪儿呢。于是发邮件给卖家问是否能提供快递单号，过了两天一直没有回复。无奈之下，打亚马逊客服，客服告诉了卖家的手机号码，我再打电话问店家，打了几次之后，电话通了，被告知快递丢件了，可以立刻再重新发我一个。虽然我特别生气，但是由于电脑急需要，所以也就没跟卖家多说，只要立刻发给我就好。结果，第二天打电话问，发货了吗？卖家说还没，下午才能发。我下午又打电话问，卖家说一定发，下午五六点之后发货，结果等我晚上七点打电话，电话就没人接了。第三天上午我又打，问货发出去了吗？可以告诉我订单号了么？卖家说没发，告诉我要是着急的话让我从别家订货，要是可以等的话下午就发。没办法，从别家下单又要等好久。就只能拜托卖家赶紧发货吧。终于再后期我无数个电话跟踪之后，我终于在10月16号收到了电脑。至于电脑的质量怎样，我不知道，因为是给别人买的，后期再追加评论吧。
en: After the purchase order of 28 September, the system indicated that the goods had been delivered and waited until 12 October, when they were still not received.Asked about the status of the Amazon order, the seller did not provide the express order number, and could not find out where the order was.The mail was sent to the seller asking whether it would be possible to provide a courier number, and no response was received for two days.Unable to do so, dialed the Amazon service, told the seller's cell phone number, and I called the shopkeeper, called the phone a few times, told that the courier had dropped the belongings and that I could be sent back immediately.Although I'm particularly angry, because of the need for computers, I don't have much to say to the seller, just send it to me immediately.As a result, the next day I called to ask if the shipment had been made. The seller said it had not yet been delivered until the afternoon.I called again this afternoon, and the seller said it had to be delivered after 5 and 6 p.m., so when I called at 7 p.m., no one answered the call.I called again the third morning, and asked if the goods had been sent. I'm gonna have to wait a long time from the other house.Just ask the seller to deliver the goods.I finally got my computer on the 16th of October after I've been tracking countless calls.As for the quality of the computer, I don't know, because it's for someone else, so let's make some comments later.

text: 很久前读的，恰巧看见了凭记忆写点读后感吧。 这本书与其说是短篇小说集，不如说是生活中关于爱情的碎片收集。本书的笔调极其平淡，是那种白开水一样的平淡，遣词造句对简约追求到了极致，情节也是像夏日午后的大街一样，寂静平淡。每一个短篇都是平凡生活中的一小段时间的剪影，没有开头，没有结局。最后收集在一起，冠名《当我们谈论爱情时我们在谈论什么》。我想，这个小说集，以及它的标题，像是一种行为艺术，作者想表达的是，爱情不止是舞台上的悲欢离合，都市传说中的海枯石烂，也不只是你侬我侬的如胶似漆，爱情不止是以上也不应该被以上代表，爱情也是平淡如水的生活，枯燥无味的日复一日，也有对生活的无措，现实的逃避，未来的茫然。 阅读这本书时你脑海里可能回想起你身旁吵架的夫妻，认识的人的索然无味的婚姻，以及不如意的感情。这正是我不推荐阅读的原因，从审美的角度上讲，本书的文笔和情节都索然无味，除非你的生活惊涛骇浪或者甜蜜得如生活在糖果城堡，否则你得阅读时的感觉就是见怪不怪和无聊。而从思想深度上，日常情节并没有让人眼前一亮或者扩展一个人的思路和视野（这点不同于马尔克斯的《霍乱时期的爱情》），短暂的片段也没有探讨任何问题，比如是什么样的错误导致了爱情的失败？主角婚姻的破裂来源于那些原因？所以我不推荐阅读这本书，读不读都没什么太大意义。 作者的想法更多地通过技巧和体裁表达而不是故事情节，也是本书阅读体验比较差的原因。
en: You read it a long time ago, and you happen to see how you feel when you write it in your memory. The book is more about the collection of pieces of love in life than a short novel.The pens of this book are extremely flat, like white open water, and the captions pursue the essence of brevity, in the same way as the streets of the afternoon after summer.Every short article is a clip of a brief period of ordinary life, without an opening or an end.And finally gathered together under the title "What are we talking about when we talk about love?"I think that this novel, and its title, is like a behavioral art, and the author would like to express that love is more than a pessimism at the stage, a dead sea in the urban legend, and more than just your cynicism, that love is not only and should not be represented above, and that love is also a life of plain water, boring day after day, as well as a lack of awareness of life, a flight from reality, a lack of future. When you read this book, you might think about the couple you're fighting with, the odious marriage you know, and the undesired feelings.That is why I do not recommend reading. From an aesthetic point of view, the writings and the plot of the book are boring, and unless your life is as stunned or as sweet as it is in Candy Castle, it is strange and boring to read.And from the depth of thought, everyday circumstances do not bring light or expand a person's thinking and vision (as opposed to Marquez's " Love during the Cholera " ), and the brief fragments do not address any problems, such as what mistakes led to the failure of love. What causes the break-up of the marriage of the protagonists? So I don't recommend reading this book, and it doesn't make much sense not to read it. The author's ideas are expressed more by skill and style than by storylines, which explains the poor reading experience of the book.
